an4.168:1.1: Then Venerable Mahāmoggallāna went up to Venerable Sāriputta, and exchanged greetings with him.
an4.168:1.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, Mahāmoggallāna sat down to one side, and said to Sāriputta:
an4.168:2.1: “Reverend Sāriputta, there are four ways of practice.
an4.168:2.3: ~Painful practice with slow insight, ~painful practice with swift insight, ~pleasant practice with slow insight, and ~pleasant practice with swift insight.
an4.168:2.4: These are the four ways of practice.
an4.168:2.5: Which one of these four ways of practice did you rely on to free your mind from defilements by not grasping?”
an4.168:3.5: I relied on the pleasant practice with swift insight to free my mind from defilements by not grasping.”
